entities.description: "FTX is an organization at the center of a fraud trial involving its Chief, Mr. Bankman-Fried."
"Mr. Bankman-Fried is the Chief of FTX and is involved in a fraud trial, with his inner circle dissolving as allies turn against him."
"The Bahamas is the location of FTX's headquarters where Mr. Bankman-Fried lived and worked with his inner circle."
"The FTX Chief’s Fraud Trial is an event that reveals the dissolving of Mr. Bankman-Fried's inner circle as friends turn against him."
"Mr. Yedidia is one of Mr. Bankman-Fried's onetime confidants, whose personal dynamics with Mr. Bankman-Fried are part of the fraud trial."
"Elijah McClain was an unarmed Black man whose case resulted in a split ruling, with one officer convicted and another acquitted."
"McClain’s Death is the event where Elijah McClain died, leading to a trial and a split ruling."
"Daniel Noboa is a businessman leading an establishment rival ahead of Ecuador’s presidential election."
"Ecuador’s Presidential Election is the upcoming event where Daniel Noboa is a leading candidate."
"Judy Chicago is a feminist artist with a six-decade survey of her work, 'Herstory,' opened at the New Museum."
"Herstory is a six-decade survey of Judy Chicago's work, which has opened at the New Museum."
"Taylor Swift’s Concert Film is an upcoming event expected to break box office records."
"Gauff is a 19-year-old tennis player who just won the U.S. Open and needs to ensure she doesn’t become a one-hit wonder."
"U.S. Open is a tennis event where Gauff recently won, marking a significant achievement in her career."
"Arizona Diamondbacks is a baseball team that swept a Dodgers team full of All-Stars and M.V.P.s."
"Dodgers is a baseball team full of All-Stars and M.V.P.s, recently swept by the Arizona Diamondbacks."

entities.description: "The New York Times Company is the publisher of the newspaper, as indicated by the copyright notice."
"Al-Shifa Hospital is a medical facility in Gaza where people are waiting for treatment amidst a crisis."
"U.N. stands for the United Nations, an international organization mentioned in the context of a humanitarian official."
"Israel Ziv is a retired Israeli Army general who responded to the attack by Hamas, grabbing his weapon and heading to the conflict zone."
"Gaza is a geographic location and the origin of the rocket attacks and gunmen mentioned in the text."
"Hamas is an armed Palestinian group controlling the Gaza territory and responsible for the attack on Israel."
"Israel is the geographic location experiencing attacks from Gaza and preparing for military operations."
"Israel Defense Forces is the military organization of Israel, mentioned in relation to Israel Ziv's past role."
"Benjamin Netanyahu is the Prime Minister of Israel, making statements about the government's stance against Hamas."
"Islamic State is a terrorist organization, compared to Hamas by Netanyahu in his statement."
"Antony J. Blinken is the U.S. secretary of state, standing with Netanyahu during his statement."
"Yaakov Amidror is a retired major general and former national security adviser, providing insights into government strategies."
"Tel Aviv is a geographic location mentioned in the context of the reporting of the airstrikes on Gaza."

entities.entity_name: "300,000 HOMELESS IN BATTERED GAZA AS FOOD RUNS LOW"
entities.description: "300,000 HOMELESS IN BATTERED GAZA AS FOOD RUNS LOW is an event describing the humanitarian crisis in Gaza due to the conflict."
"Audi is the manufacturer of the white car that Israel Ziv used to drive to the Gaza border."
"Unity Government is the governing body in Israel that must approve military plans against Hamas."
"The killing of more than 1,200 Israeli civilians is an event cited as a reason for the military operation against Hamas."
"The call-up of 360,000 reservists is an event indicating Israel's preparation for a major military operation."
"Islamic organization refers to Hamas, which is described as having ruled the Gaza enclave for 17 years."
"The 2 million residents of Gaza are affected by the crisis, facing shortages of food, water, and fuel."
"The death of more than 1,500 people is a result of the Israeli bombardment in Gaza."
"The injury of over 6,600 others is a consequence of the Israeli bombardment in Gaza."
"The kidnapping of about 150 hostages is part of the attack by Hamas on Israel."
"Gaza’s only power plant is an infrastructure that stopped generating electricity due to lack of fuel."

relationships.description: "The New York Times Company reports on the situation at Al-Shifa Hospital in Gaza."
"A U.N. humanitarian official comments on the disaster at Al-Shifa Hospital."
"Israel Ziv takes action against Hamas during their attack."
"Israel Ziv is a retired general and former head of the operations directorate of the Israel Defense Forces."
"Benjamin Netanyahu vows to crush Hamas and compares them to the Islamic State."
"Netanyahu draws a comparison between Hamas and the Islamic State to emphasize the threat posed by Hamas."
"Yaakov Amidror, a former national security adviser to Netanyahu, discusses strategies against Hamas."
"Israel Ziv drove his new white Audi to the Gaza border during the conflict."
"The Unity Government seeks to dismantle Hamas to ensure it can never threaten Israel again."
"The Islamic organization Hamas rules over the 2 million residents of the Gaza enclave."
"The Israeli bombardment resulted in the death of more than 1,500 people in Gaza."
"The Israeli bombardment injured over 6,600 others in Gaza."
"Hamas was responsible for the kidnapping of about 150 hostages during the attack on Israel."
"The shutdown of Gaza’s only power plant affects the 2 million residents by cutting off electricity."

entities.description: "The Israeli government is mentioned as providing information about an attack and its consequences."
"Gaza is described as suffering from a lack of electricity, water, and other resources, with overwhelmed hospitals and a dire humanitarian situation."
"The United Nations agency is involved in aiding Palestinian refugees, with an official describing the situation in Gaza as 'absolutely horrible'."
"Adnan Abu Hasna is an official with the United Nations agency that aids Palestinian refugees, providing a firsthand account of the conditions in Gaza."
"The United States is mentioned for stepping up its weapons shipments to Israel, indicating involvement in the conflict."
"Antony J. Blinken, the Secretary of State, is involved in reinforcing support for Israel alongside Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu."
"Benjamin Netanyahu, the Prime Minister of Israel, is mentioned in the context of receiving support from the United States."
"Hamas is mentioned as the group that conducted an attack near the Israeli border, causing significant casualties and disruptions."
"Steve Scalise is a Representative from Louisiana who withdrew from consideration for the speakership after not gaining enough support."
"Jim Jordan is a Representative from Ohio and a challenger for the speakership, supported by former President Donald J. Trump."
"Donald J. Trump, the former President, is mentioned as endorsing Jim Jordan for the speakership."
"The G.O.P. (Republican Party) is described as being in chaos due to infighting, which has left the House leaderless."
"Oregon is mentioned as the home state of Steve Huckins, who is moving away due to the societal and political climate."
"Steve Huckins is a native of Oregon who is moving to Missouri due to dissatisfaction with the political climate in Portland."
"Ginger is the wife of Steve Huckins, and they are moving together from Oregon to Missouri."
"Missouri is the state where Steve Huckins and his wife are moving to, seeking a different political and societal environment."
"Iowa is the state from which Jennie and Jeff Noble are moving, due to the banning of gender-affirming medical care for minors."
"Jennie Noble is a resident of Iowa who is moving to Minnesota with her family for better LGBTQ+ protections."
"Jeff Noble is the husband of Jennie Noble, and they are moving from Iowa to Minnesota together."
"Julien is the transgender son of Jennie and Jeff Noble, who is a factor in their decision to move to Minnesota."
"Minnesota is the state to which Jennie and Jeff Noble are moving, seeking better LGBTQ+ protections for their transgender son."
